cu.rst.core.petrinet

Class Transition

  • java.lang.Object
    • cu.rst.core.petrinet.Transition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PetriNetElementIntf

    public class Transition
extends java.lang.Object
implements PetriNetElementIntf
    A transition embeds an algorithm and a transition is triggered only when there are enough tokens in the input places. Logic to determine if there are enough tokens is as follows:
    total required tokens is the sum of weights on all incoming edges of t
    total available tokens is the sum of the tokens in the input places of t if(total available tokens >= total required tokens) then the transition is fired. Once the transition is fired, number of tokens deleted in each input place = weight of the edge leading to it.
    Author:
    partheinstein

      • canFire

        public boolean canFire()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns whether there are sufficient tokens in the input places of this transition. This method is used to determine whether to fire this transition or not.
        Parameters:
        tokens -
        Returns:
        Throws:

      • fire

        @Deprecated
public boolean fire()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Deprecated. 
        Fires the transition. This method will fire only if it can. If it can't, its a no-op. If it fires, tokens are added to the outgoing places and removed from the incoming places according to the incoming edge weight.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • fire2

        public boolean fire2()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Fires the transition. This method will fire only if it can. If it can't, its a no-op. If it fires, tokens are added to the outgoing places and removed from the incoming places according to the incoming edge weight.
        This method differs from fire() because it invokes update(ArrayList, Place)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        cu.rst.core.petrinet.PetriNetElementIntf#update(ArrayList, Place)}

      • update

        public java.util.ArrayList update(java.util.ArrayList<Token> tokens)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Specified by:
        update in interface PetriNetElementIntf
        Returns:
        After an update has happened, the transition may provide a list of changes in terms of reputation edges/trust edges which are added to each token and put in the outgoing places. The places then do the necessary update to themselves (for e.g. add the edges in the list of changes in each token.) After updating, the places may return a list of changes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • update

        public java.util.ArrayList update(java.util.ArrayList<Token> tokens,
                         Place p)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: PetriNetElementIntf
        This method must be overwritten if an algorithm needs to tell the testbed what changes to make in what outgoing place. For example you have rg0<->alg->rg1 as the workflow. In this case, the alg may want to only add new edges to rg1 but not to rg0. Or maybe the alg may want to add different set of edges to rg0 vs rg1
        Specified by:
        update in interface PetriNetElementIntf
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
